questions.question: The 'Delta Variant' off COVID-19 was first identified in?
questions.explanation: The Delta variant (also called B.1.617.2 ) is one of the variants of the SARS-CoV-2 virus that causes COVID-19. It was first detected in India in October 2020 . The variant quickly became a concern because it is more transmissible than the original strain and some other variants. The World Health Organization (WHO) classified it as a Variant of Concern (VOC) in May 2021 . It caused large waves of infection in many countries due to its high spread rate. So the correct origin country is India .

questions.explanation: ধরি, ছোট জোড় সংথ্যা = 2 x =2 x = 2 x প্রশ্নমতে, 2 x ( 2 x + 2 ) = 168 2 x(2 x+2)=168 2 x ( 2 x + 2 ) = 168 ⇒ x ( x + 1 ) = 42 ⇒ x 2 + x − 42 = 0 ⇒ ( x + 7 ) ( x − 6 ) = 0 ∴ x = 6 ∴ 2 x = 12 \begin{array}{l} \Rightarrow \mathrm{x}(\mathrm{x}+1)=42 \Rightarrow \mathrm{x}^{2}+\mathrm{x}-42=0 \Rightarrow(\mathrm{x}+7)(\mathrm{x}-6)=0 \\ \therefore \mathrm{x}=6 \\ \therefore 2 \mathrm{x}=12 \end{array} ⇒ x ( x + 1 ) = 42 ⇒ x 2 + x − 42 = 0 ⇒ ( x + 7 ) ( x − 6 ) = 0 ∴ x = 6 ∴ 2 x = 12 ​
